description: Conversion of existing garage into habitable space and minor internal alterations.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.	Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development shall conform in all material aspects with the plans and details shown in the application as listed below, unless variations are agreed by the Local Planning Authority in order to discharge other conditions attached to this decision:Reason:  For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
Condition 4 - RBK Design Team have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this condition can now be discharged.
Condition 5 - RBK Design Team have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this condition can now be discharged.
Condition 6 - RBK Design Team have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this condition can now be discharged.

I acknowledge receipt of your BACS payments totalling £18,000.00, the fee required for this application is £30,000.00, therefore please forward the outstanding balance of £12,000.00 as soon as possible.Note:  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by BACS payment or cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames.

I acknowledge receipt of your BACS payments totalling £18,000.00, the fee required for this application is £30,000.00, therefore please forward the balance of £12,000.00 as soon as possible, this as before can be paid by BACS or by contacting our Contact Centre quoting the reference number on 0208 547 5002.Note:  Payment has been agreed by Toby Feltham, therefore please pay the balance over the next month in order to clear the required amount payable.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Tree compromised and failing as per submission.Recommendation:No objections.
